Class ChamberTest

public class ChamberTest extends Object
ChamberTest tests the class Chamber

    void
    testUpdateCoinsTwice(Map<it.polimi.ingsw.model.Clan,Integer> addingStudents, Map<it.polimi.ingsw.model.Clan,Integer> remove, Map<it.polimi.ingsw.model.Clan,Integer> newAddingStudents, Map<it.polimi.ingsw.model.Clan,Integer> expectedCoinsGiven, int expectedCoins)
    testUpdateCoinsDouble method tests that a coin is not given twice, after a student is removed and re-added from a particular givenCoin position In the first case, is expected that in the first cell of coinsGiven, even when 3 students are re-added, the CoinsGiven remains 1 In the second scenario, is expected that the in second cell of coinsGiven only one coin is added compared to the previous situation, in fact just one new givenCoin position is covered In the third case, is expected that in the fourth cell of coinsGiven the coins remain 3, even if not all the three givenCoin position are covered

  • Method Details

    • initialization

      @BeforeEach public void initialization()

    • testAddStudents

      @ParameterizedTest @MethodSource("addStudentsArguments") public void testAddStudents(Map<it.polimi.ingsw.model.Clan,Integer> addingStudents, Map<it.polimi.ingsw.model.Clan,Integer> expectedAddedStudents)
      Method testAddStudents tests, in the first case, the adding of students in the Chamber in normal condition, adding a smaller number of students that the number that the chamber allows. Is expected that all the students are added In the second case the method tests if the Chamber doesn't add student in the Chamber when it is full Is expected that even if you try to add a number of students greater than 10, that will be the resulting number of students present in the chamber
      Parameters:
      addingStudents - students to add to the chamber
      expectedAddedStudents - students expected to be present on the chamber after calling the method addStudents

    • testRemoveStudents

      @ParameterizedTest @MethodSource("removeStudentsArguments") public void testRemoveStudents(Map<it.polimi.ingsw.model.Clan,Integer> addingStudents, Map<it.polimi.ingsw.model.Clan,Integer> removingStudents, Map<it.polimi.ingsw.model.Clan,Integer> expectedStudents, Map<it.polimi.ingsw.model.Clan,Integer> expectedRemoved)
      testRemoveStudents method tests the removal of the students from a Chamber that doesn't have that number of students. Is expected that in cases where the number of students to be removed is greater than the number of those present, only the students actually present in the chamber are removed
      Parameters:
      addingStudents - students to add to the chamber and set the initial conditions
      removingStudents - students to remove from the chamber
      expectedStudents - students expected to be present on the chamber after calling the method removeStudents
      expectedRemoved - students expected to be removed from the chamber after calling the method removeStudents

    • testHasProfessor

      @Test public void testHasProfessor()
      testHasProfessor tests if, in the initial condition, the HasProfessor method return false

    • testUpdateCoins

      @ParameterizedTest @MethodSource("updateCoinsArguments") public void testUpdateCoins(Map<it.polimi.ingsw.model.Clan,Integer> addingStudents, Map<it.polimi.ingsw.model.Clan,Integer> expectedCoinsGiven, int numOfCoins)
      testUpdateCoins method tests if the calculation for the attribution of coins is correct after the initial addition of students. Is expected a coin to be given after each addiction of 3 students.
      Parameters:
      addingStudents - students to add to the chamber and set the initial conditions
      expectedCoinsGiven - coins expected to be given for each clan, after adding students to the chamber
      numOfCoins - total number of coins obtained after adding students to the chamber

    • testUpdateCoinsTwice

      @ParameterizedTest @MethodSource("updateCoinsTwiceArguments") public void testUpdateCoinsTwice(Map<it.polimi.ingsw.model.Clan,Integer> addingStudents, Map<it.polimi.ingsw.model.Clan,Integer> remove, Map<it.polimi.ingsw.model.Clan,Integer> newAddingStudents, Map<it.polimi.ingsw.model.Clan,Integer> expectedCoinsGiven, int expectedCoins)
      testUpdateCoinsDouble method tests that a coin is not given twice, after a student is removed and re-added from a particular givenCoin position In the first case, is expected that in the first cell of coinsGiven, even when 3 students are re-added, the CoinsGiven remains 1 In the second scenario, is expected that the in second cell of coinsGiven only one coin is added compared to the previous situation, in fact just one new givenCoin position is covered In the third case, is expected that in the fourth cell of coinsGiven the coins remain 3, even if not all the three givenCoin position are covered
      Parameters:
      addingStudents - students to add to the chamber and set the initial conditions
      remove - students to remove from the chamber
      newAddingStudents - students to add to the chamber
      expectedCoinsGiven - coins expected to be given for each clan, after adding students to the chamber
      expectedCoins - total number of coins obtained after adding students to the chamber

    • testAddStudent

      @ParameterizedTest @EnumSource(it.polimi.ingsw.model.Clan.class) public void testAddStudent(it.polimi.ingsw.model.Clan clan)
      testAddStudent method tests if, in an unfilled chamber, the AddStudent method add a student of a particular chosen clan
      Parameters:
      clan - is the clan of belonging of the students on which we are going to test the method

    • testAddInAFullChamber

      @ParameterizedTest @EnumSource(it.polimi.ingsw.model.Clan.class) public void testAddInAFullChamber(it.polimi.ingsw.model.Clan clan)
      test if the addStudents method doesn't add the student of a particular clan if in the Chamber there are already 10 students of that clan Is expected a false return and an unmodified situation of the students
      Parameters:
      clan - is the clan of belonging of the students on which we are going to test the method
